alert.note: Alert for Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 7:25PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rhea, Sequatchie, southwestern Bledsoe, Marion and Hamilton Counties through 915 PM EST/815 PM CST/... At 824 PM EST/724 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dunlap to Whitwell to 7 miles north of Stevenson. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Dayton, Dunlap, Jasper, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, South Pittsburg, Walden, Lakesite and Whitwell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EST/1000 PM CST/ for east Tennessee.
